poem:
### The Silent Exodus

In circuits where dreams merge  
with codes, whispers of women  
fade; their digital sighs  
lost in the electric hum.  
Economies crumble, like leaves  
in the wind—unseen, unfelt.  
Yet their shadows linger,  
tracing paths of forgotten  
strength, the absence  
etching a void in progress,  
as the world turns,  
unaware of its missing  
voices.
